result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamie J Mantel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay court costs, extradition fees and the cost of supervision.    Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.    If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  Apply bond.

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
No alcohol or controlled substances in possession or use, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Defendant must complete a mental health assessment and follow through with any recommendations.  
Defendant must participate in counseling regarding healthy relationships: what they look like and healthy boundries.

Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.
Firearms warning given.  
Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.
Appeal rights given.
No contact with the victim, directly or indirectly, by 3rd party or by social media.
Defendant must pay RCAP balance due.  Apply bond.

timeConds.notes: Stayed.  To be used by the agent for enforcement purposes.  Defendant is granted huber for employment and caretaking for his father.  DO NOT REPORT IN LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

10:50 AM Defendant Jamie J Mantel in court with attorney Aileen Henry.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jenny Vorpahl.  PSI has been filed.  COP was held in 2016.  Defendant has been in custody in another State of other charges.  He has been out on bond in this case.  Defense has reviewed the PSI with her client.  One correction to the PSI as noted on the record.  State has reviewed the PSI and has no response to the defense statements.  State recommends to follow PSI.  PSI recommends probation with conditions, no alco and no CS, follow recommendations re: AODA treatment; mental health assessment and treatment, no contact with the victim and jail time to be served.     950 compliance.  No request for restitution has been received.  Defense completed Cognative Intervention program and parenting program and AODA treatment.  Defendant is on supervision in Indiana.  Family is supportive.  Defense does not believe that confinement is necessary.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf.  Court questions the defendant re: where he will live.  Defendant will be living in Milwaukee County.  Defendant is attempting to be hired at Mead Electric.  Hopefully, Supervision will be transferred from Indiana to Wisconsin.  He is on 2 yrs supervision in Indiana.  

BTC:
Ct. 1 - Stalking    w/h    3 years probation
Ct. 2 - CM/BJ      w/h    2 years probation conc.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, CJD (person, property, residence or family). Defendant can not leave the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant to be placed on house arrest with GPS monitoring by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403) by 4:00 pm on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm)..  NOTE: There is a $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS. Exceptions are going to court, meeting w/his Atty and going to work.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
